paragraph.paragraph: Adding Eiffel url*clusters to ../index.xmlProjects is a similar process to adding_items.xmlAdd New Project Items or adding_folders.xmlAdd New Project Folders, in EiffelEnvision. For more information about the notion of a cluster, see url*Conventions.

url*Clusters are different from other urlFolders in an EiffelEnvision index.xmlProject, in that url*clusters cannot be added just anywhere. url*Cluster Nodes can only appear directly under the following:
url*Project Items.
url*Eiffel Libraries.
Other url*Cluster Nodes.

To add a url*clusters to anyone of these nodes, select the node in the ../index.xmlProject, then select Project, Add New Cluster from the main menu.
Select a node you would like to add a url*clusters under.
From the Project menu select Add New Cluster
A folder dialog will appear requesting you choose a location for the new cluster. Select a folder and click Ok.
Recommended: It is recommended that you follow the adding_cluster_guidelines.xmlAdding Cluster Guidelines when adding a new cluster to your project. It will enable future management and maintance of EiffelEnvision projects much easier, as well as maintain a clean separation between project files and Eiffel libraries.
The new_cluster_wizard.xmlNew Cluster Wizard will then appear.

For folders appearing under url*Cluster Nodes, as a result of setting the url*Include Subdirectories property to Yes, they are applicable to a promotion to a url*Cluster Node. url*Cluster Folder Nodes have no properties as url*Cluster Nodes do, so will inherit their properties from the url*Cluster Node. It may be necessary to convert url*Cluster Folder Nodes into url*Cluster Nodes for reason such as url*Inclusing and Excluding Eiffel source files, attain a finer-grained control over url*Assertions, etc. For all folders directly beneath a url*Cluster Node, Convert to Cluster is available from the folder's context menu. Select it will promote the folder to a url*Cluster Node and allow you to modify the url*Properties without affecting the parent url*Cluster Node.

In the same vein as Convert to Cluster, Revert to Folder provides the opposite operation. Revert to Folder is available from a url*Cluster Node's context menu. Reverting to a folder may only be performed on the following condititions:
The url*Path of the url*Cluster Node is a first level child to the parent url*Cluster Node's url*Path.
The url*Cluster Node does not contain any child url*Cluster Node's of it's own
The parent url*Cluster Node's url*Include Subdirectories or url*Library property is set to Yes.
Selecting Revert to Folder will demote the chosen url*Cluster Node to a url*Cluster Folder Node, discarding all set properties.
